Search File section

To search by hash, enter the file SHA256 value. When you search by hash, you can also search for deleted instances of this file on the endpoint.

Selected Answer: C

C is about incidents only, including their MTTR.

questions.question_text: Which built-in dashboard would be the best option for an executive, if they were looking for the Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) metric?
If you have an isolated network that is prevented from connecting to the Cortex Data Lake, which type of Broker VM setup can you use to facilitate the communication?

discussion.content: B. Cortex XDR in restricted networks where endpoints do not have a direct connection to the internet, setup the Broker VM to act as a proxy

Selected Answer: B
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/Cortex-XDR-Prevent-Administrator-Guide/Activate-the-Local-Agent-Settings

Selected Answer: B
Sorry I mistakenly selected C, ıt should be B.

To deploy Cortex XDR in restricted networks where endpoints do not have a direct connection to the internet, setup the Broker VM to act as a proxy that routes all the traffic between the Cortex XDR management server and XDR agents/XDR Collectors via a centralized and controlled access point

Selected Answer: C
To deploy Cortex XDR in restricted networks where endpoints do not have a direct connection to the internet, setup the Broker VM to act as a proxy that routes all the traffic between the Cortex XDR management server and XDR agents/XDR Collectors via a centralized and controlled access point...

Selected Answer: B
I agree it is B
Correct Answer B

Selected Answer: B
I believe the answer is B.

Here is the admin guide, see the second bullet: https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/Cortex-XDR-Pro-Administrator-Guide/Activate-the-Local-Agent-Settings

Caching just means it will cache the data, but if it doesn't have the data it will try to go get it. This won't work in an isolated network so C isn't correct.

choices.C: Local Agent Installer and Content Caching

questions.question_text: What is by far the most common tactic used by ransomware to shut down a victim’s operation?

choices.A: preventing the victim from being able to access APIs to cripple infrastructure
choices.C: restricting access to administrative accounts to the victim
choices.B: denying traffic out of the victims network until payment is received
choices.D: encrypting certain files to prevent access by the victim

discussion.content: admin guide pg/ 82 hints that this might be the answer

Selected Answer: D
I didn't find it the guide but I think it is common knowledge that ransomware does this action

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.
D - correct
